1.comment: Kenyan Drake ended up scoring a late touchdown, as he ran for 12 yards on 2 carries. Drake is a candidate to see a larger workload once the Dolphins figure out that using Ajayi is not in their best interest. Isaiah Pead will also be a factor when he gets healthy.

2.comment: Kenyan Drake started over Jay Ajayi, but they shared carries along with Isaiah Pead.

rushing_attempts.sentence: Kenyan Drake (2-15), Damien Williams (2-9) and Isaiah Pead (3-5) barely did anything.

opponent_score.sentence: Had Drake not scored, Tannehill would've been asked to drive down the field with a 23-20 deficit, and based on how he was perfoming in the second half, I don't think he could've done that.

5.comment: Kenyan Drake also had a good game for the Dolphins. He saw 4 carries for 56 yards, but most of his yardage came on a 45-yard touchdown. Drake looked to be wrapped up, but he escaped on the play and ran out to the sideline. None of the Bills could catch him as he scored. rushing_attempts.sentence: Drake had more carries than Williams, 9-7, and outgained him 69-14, thanks to a 42-yard burst.

6.comment: Kenyan Drake and Damien Williams split touches.Drake and Damien Williams split touches. Drake had more carries than Williams, 9-7, and outgained him 69-14, thanks to a 42-yard burst. However, Drake hurt his team with a lost fumble in the red zone when Miami led 6-3. Instead of taking control of the game, the Dolphins saw the Raiders capitalize with a score of their own following the turnover. Drake and Williams caught 6 passes each for 35 and 47 yards, respectively, with Williams scoring once aerially. Williams also had a long reception negated by a Landry hold. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

rushing_attempts.sentence: Kenyan Drake mustered only 4 yards on 7 attempts, though he had a 6-yard scamper where he displayed some impressive cuts.

7.comment: Kenyan Drake mustered only 4 yards on 7 attempts, though he had a 6-yard scamper where he displayed some impressive cuts. The problem is Miami's offensive line, which is a train wreck.    The Buccaneers couldn't run the ball very well either.
